update.description:
depends on this [ign-sensors pull request](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/pull-requests/36/add-logical-camera-sensor/diff)

The logical camera sensor is created using the new SensorFactory class in ign-sensors. IThe sensor relies on information about models in the world, i.e. model names and poses. The system gets this information through components and passes it to the logical camera sensor in ign-sensors.
update.title: [A-8] Add logical camera sensor system

content.raw: Sorry, this was just a question about limitations. Double quotes is fine.

content.raw: We've been using `::` for entity names and `/` for topic names. So just confirming, we're switching to use `/` for entity names now?
content.html: We've been using :: for entity names and / for topic names. So just confirming, we're switching to use / for entity names now?

content.raw: It looks like both the camera and the lidar are not being deleted at all right now, they just keep publishing
content.html: It looks like both the camera and the lidar are not being deleted at all right now, they just keep publishing

content.raw: I think this is likely a problem with how sensor plugins are created and loaded in ign-sensors. Do you recall if the same problem occurs with gpu lidar?
content.html: I think this is likely a problem with how sensor plugins are created and loaded in ign-sensors. Do you recall if the same problem occurs with gpu lidar?

content.raw:
I noticed the sensor is not being destructed, how to reproduce:

1. Launch the demo world: `ign-gazebo -v 4 -f examples/worlds/logical_camera_sensor.sdf` and unpause
1. Echo the topic: `ign topic -e -t /logical_camera` - messages show up properly
1. Delete the sensor: `ign service -s /world/logical_camera_sensor/remove --reqtype ignition.msgs.Entity --reptype ignition.msgs.Boolean --timeout 300 --req 'name: "logical_camera" type: MODEL'` 
1. You'll notice the messages stop coming, probably because the sensor is no longer in the map and being updated, but if you do `ign topic -i -t /logical_camera` you still see the publisher
content.html:
I noticed the sensor is not being destructed, how to reproduce:

  1. Launch the demo world: ign-gazebo -v 4 -f examples/worlds/logical_camera_sensor.sdf and unpause
  2. Echo the topic: ign topic -e -t /logical_camera - messages show up properly
  3. Delete the sensor: ign service -s /world/logical_camera_sensor/remove --reqtype ignition.msgs.Entity --reptype ignition.msgs.Boolean --timeout 300 --req 'name: "logical_camera" type: MODEL'
  4. You'll notice the messages stop coming, probably because the sensor is no longer in the map and being updated, but if you do ign topic -i -t /logical_camera you still see the publisher

content.raw: How about storing `unique_ptrs` instead? I noticed we're never calling `delete` on the sensors, should we?
content.html: How about storing unique_ptrs instead? I noticed we're never calling delete on the sensors, should we?

content.raw: Missing `param[in]`
content.html: Missing param[in]

content.raw:
I brought back the changes in [e46d348](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/commits/e46d3482e6e9377e66dc8116335bf262657de49b) and [32b36a2](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/commits/32b36a2267e6805bfaef4132d6061ce9d092f48c) 

I noticed that the ign transport does not require the `/` prefix in the topic names - it gets automatically prepended. So I modified the `scopedName` function to  return a string without the delimiter at the beginning
content.html:
I brought back the changes in e46d348 and 32b36a2 

I noticed that the ign transport does not require the / prefix in the topic names - it gets automatically prepended. So I modified the scopedName function to return a string without the delimiter at the beginning

content.raw: Gotcha. So right now with the parent name not being scoped, there's no way for whoever is receiving the sensor message to tell the exact parent entity, right? I imagine we will have many sensors whose parents are just called `link`?
content.html: Gotcha. So right now with the parent name not being scoped, there's no way for whoever is receiving the sensor message to tell the exact parent entity, right? I imagine we will have many sensors whose parents are just called link?

content.raw: yeah, I actually did that before by modifying the `scopedNamed` function  but reverted the change in [this commit](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/commits/087499058ca0067dd0a0fda0f326037b4a9e5753). I though it was a bit hacky because after removing the prefix \(e.g. `model`, `link`, and `sensor` in `::model::model_name::link::link_name::sensor::sensor_name`\), I still had to remove the `::` delimiter at the beginning. I can bring the change back if you think it’ll be useful
content.html: yeah, I actually did that before by modifying the scopedNamed function but reverted the change in this commit. I though it was a bit hacky because after removing the prefix (e.g. model, link, and sensor in ::model::model_name::link::link_name::sensor::sensor_name), I still had to remove the :: delimiter at the beginning. I can bring the change back if you think it’ll be useful
